intro: Platostoma annamense, commonly known as the Annam stonecrop, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Crassulaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and compact growth habit. The plant typically grows in rocky or shaded environments, showcasing its adaptability to arid conditions. Its small, star-shaped flowers are usually white or pale pink, blooming in clusters during the spring. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
